basics.name: Nearchos Potamitis, MSc.
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: PhD student at Aarhus University researching efficiency and reliability in LLM reasoning.

work.name: Aarhus University, Denmark
work.summary: Focused on improving the reasoning ability and the cost-quality trade-off of Large Language Models (LLMs). As a first author, two full papers accepted to ICML 2025 and EMNLP 2025. Advisor: Prof. Akhil Arora.

work.name: European Parliament
work.summary: Schuman trainee at the AI unit of the European Parliament. Leveraging LLMs to assess whether an application to the Transparency Register adheres to the applicable regulations.

work.name: DLAB, EPFL, Switzerland
work.summary: Introduced Fleet of Agents, a novel framework utilizing LLMs as agents to navigate through dynamic tree searches. Introduced CacheSaver, a framework that facilitates LLM requests by utilizing asynchronous, batched mechanisms. Perfect grade of 6/6 (top 1%).

work.name: Prediggo SA, Switzerland
work.summary: Developed an LLM-powered conversational bot to streamline business rule creation, enhancing user experience and accessibility.

work.name: EPFL FUSTIC, Switzerland
work.summary: Conducted an extensive literature review and led the data collection and analysis of modern urban platforms, evaluating their capabilities in Urban Digital Twins.

education.institution: Swiss Federal Institute of Technology, Lausanne (EPFL)
courses: Thesis: Fleet of Agents: Coordinated Problem Solving with Large Language Models

education.institution: Swiss Federal Institute of Technology, Lausanne (EPFL)

publications.name: Fleet of Agents: Coordinated Problem Solving with Large Language Models
publications.summary: A novel framework utilizing LLMs as agents to navigate through dynamic tree searches, employing a genetic-type particle filtering approach.

publications.name: CacheSaver: A Modular Framework for Efficient, Affordable, and Reproducible LLM Inference
publications.summary: A framework that facilitates LLM requests by utilizing asynchronous, batched mechanisms to optimize costs and response time.

publications.name: ReasonBench: Benchmarking the (In)Stability of LLM Reasoning
publications.summary: Benchmarking the stability and reliability of LLM reasoning capabilities.

publications.name: Are Retrials All You Need? Enhancing Large Language Model Reasoning Without Verbalized Feedback
publications.summary: Exploring retrials as a method for enhancing LLM reasoning without verbalized feedback.
